name: Business Valuation
desc:
Business valuation is an essential tool to assess both the opportunities as well as opportunity costs in future if the business is planning for future growth or even for transition. It’s required for business owners to evaluate their business as well as for investors who are willing to invest in the business.

We, at Kaares, with the help of our specialised professionals provide business valuation to the clients and also guide them on how to improve their valuations in case there are any weaknesses in the business.

features.text: Thorough Due Diligence and Structured Evaluation

featuresdesc: In the ever-changing global services landscape, it is critical to recognize the actual worth of your company. It gives you the ability to protect your money, take advantage of growth opportunities, and make well-informed decisions. Kares is your reliable travel companion, offering professional business valuation and financial modelling services to steer you in the direction of a profitable future.

otherservices.title: Business Valuation
points: Business valuation is the process of determining the economic value of a business or company.

Market approach: This method estimates the value of a business by comparing it to similar businesses in the same industry. This approach typically uses metrics such as price-to-earnings ratio, price-to-sales ratio, and price-to-book ratio.

Income approach: This method estimates the value of a business by projecting future cash flows and discounting them to present value. This approach typically uses metrics such as net present value, discounted cash flow, and capitalization rate.

Asset-based approach: This method estimates the value of a business by assessing the value of its assets minus its liabilities. This approach typically uses metrics such as book value, liquidation value, and replacement value.

otherservices.title: Valuation for Merger/Acquisition
points: Valuation for a merger or acquisition (M&A) is a critical process to determine the fair price or value of the target company.
We use several methods for this such as Comparable Company Analysis (CCA), Discounted cash flow (DCF) analysis, Asset-based approach, and Transaction multiple analysis.
We advise clients on the fair value of businesses and help to analyze targets for acquisitions.
We also help clients in various strategic decision making including divestment, business restructuring, computation of swap ratio or merger, etc.

otherservices.title: ESOP Valuation for Accounting or Taxation purposes
points: We assist clients in determining strike prices for employee stock option plans and also carry out the valuation of options.

The valuation process typically involves the following steps: Determine the purpose of the valuation, Select the valuation method, Gather financial and market data, Perform the valuation analysis, Document the valuation.

otherservices.title: Intangible Valuation
points: Intangible asset valuation is the process of determining the value of a company’s intangible assets, such as patents, trademarks, copyrights, customer relationships, brand reputation, and proprietary technology.
It generally includes – Cost approach, Market approach, and Income approach.
Kares helps clients in valuable assets for a company which are not always easily quantifiable and which makes the valuation process more complex.

otherservices.title: Goodwill and Asset Impairment Testing (US GAAP/IFRS/Indian GAAP)
points: Goodwill is recognized as an asset on the balance sheet but it is not amortized like other intangible assets.
Instead, it is subject to annual impairment testing to determine whether its carrying value exceeds its far value.

Goodwill impairment testing is a two-step process: Step 1 involves comparing the fair value of the reporting unit to its carrying value, including goodwill. Step 2: If impairment is indicated, the implied fair value of goodwill is calculated by allocating the fair value of the reporting unit to all of its assets and liabilities, including any unrecognized intangible assets.
We help clients in reviewing annual goodwill impairment by valuing each reporting unit and quantification of the amount of impairment if any.

otherservices.title: Purchase Price Allocation
points: We assist our clients in Purchase price allocations for the fair value of assets (tangible/intangible) and liabilities that have been acquired consequence to a transaction.
We also advise clients in understanding accounting impacts pre and post-deal execution.
While carrying out the PPA, we also highlight issues around potential and subsequent goodwill impairment.

otherservices.title: Valuation for regulatory compliances e.g. Income Tax, Companies Act, FEMA, IFRS, etc
points: In the current regulatory environment, companies require valuation analysis for various regulatory and compliance purposes, including Income Tax Act, Companies Act, 2013, FEMA, IFRS, etc.
We assist clients in assessing the fair value of their business for these regulatory compliances.

We assist our clients in the restructuring/reorganization of their group structure by evaluating and analyzing their core and non-core assets and valuing the assets.
